### **RECEIVING WATER CONCENTRATION CALCULATIONS**
#### **calculations from 1991 Technical Support Document pgs 51-55**
#### **assuming a 95% confidence level and a 95% probability basis**
\begin{align*}
Number of samples & = n\\
Maximum effluent concentration & = max\\
Dilution Ratio & = DR\\
Coefficient of Variation (CV) & = S_{n}/\mu or 0.6 when n \le 10\\
Z-statistic & = Z_{x}\\
RPM & = \displaystyle \frac{exp(Z_{95}\ln(1 + CV^{2})^{0.5} - 0.5\ln(1 + CV^{2}))}{exp(Z_{x}\ln(1 + CV^{2})^{0.5} - 0.5\ln(1 + CV^{2}))}\\
RWC & = maximum effluent concentration * RPM * Dilution Ratio\\
\\
n & = `r params$nsam`\\
max & = `r params$pmx`\\
DR & = `r params$DR`\\
CV & = `r params$pcv`\\
Z_{95} & = `r params$pz95`\\
Z_{x} & = `r params$pzx`\\
\\
RPM & = \displaystyle \frac{exp(`r params$pz95`\ln(1 + `r params$pcv`^{2})^{0.5} - 0.5\ln(1 + `r params$pcv`^{2}))}{exp(`r params$pzx`\ln(1 + `r params$pcv`^{2})^{0.5} - 0.5\ln(1 + `r params$pcv`^{2}))}\\
 & = `r params$RPM`\\
 \\
RWC & = `r params$pmx` * `r params$RPM` * `r params$DR`\\
 & = `r params$RWC`
\end{align*}
